subject: 930a 6/22 Update: SMG forecast
body:
930a 6/22 Update: SMG forecast



=================================

CBS NEWS STS-117 STATUS REPORT: 90
Posted: 9:07 AM, 6/22/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Analyst

Changes and additions:

   SR-87 (06/21/07): Re-entry delayed one day due to weather
   SR-88 (06/21/07): Updated deorbit timelines
   SR-89 (06/22/07): Astronauts gear up for entry
   SR-90 (06/22/07): Updated weather forecast

=================================

9:07 AM, 6/22/07, Update: Forecast calls for possible showers near Kennedy Space Center; good conditions at Edwards

The Spaceflight Meteorology Group at the Johnson Space Center in Houston is predicting just a chance of showers at the Kennedy Space Center for the first opportunity to bring the shuttle Atlantis back to Earth today. But conditions in Florida are expected to deteriorate as the day wears on, with thunderstorms popping up one orbit later.

Commander Rick Sturckow and his crewmates have two opportunities on successive orbits to land in Florida, and three opportunities to land at Edwards Air Force Base, Calif. The first Edwards opportunity comes on the same orbit as the second Florida opportunity and conditions in California are expected to be "go." But the wind likely will kick up later in the day and it would appear Sturckow's best chance for getting home today is the first opportunity in Florida or the first at Edwards.

Here's how the forecast shapes up (all times in EDT):


DAY...EDT..........DD...HH...MM...SS...EVENT

Fri  01:12:34 PM...13...17...34...30...KSC: Deorbit on rev 218
Fri  02:18:30 PM...13...18...40...26...KSC: Landing

Forecast: Scattered clouds at 3,000 and 8,000 feet, broken clouds at
25,000 feet; Winds out of 300 degrees at 8 knots with peaks to 13; a
chance of showers within 30 nautical miles.

Fri  02:43:39 PM...13...19...05...35...EDW: Deorbit on rev 219
Fri  03:49:54 PM...13...20...11...50...EDW: Landing

Forecast: Few clouds, winds from 240 degrees at 7 knots with gusts to
11; no constraints

Fri  02:50:31 PM...13...19...12...27...KSC: Deorbit on rev 219
Fri  03:55:00 PM...13...20...16...56...KSC: Landing

Forecast: Winds shift to 200 degrees, 9 knots gusting to 13;
constraint: chance of thunderstorms within 30 nautical miles

The winds at Edwards are expected to pick up as the day wears on, gusting to 27 knots by the third opportunity.
